name: Evan Smith
bio: Junior in Computer Science at Brigham Young University

responsibilities: Develop and maintain client-facing application with TypeScript and React
Work across the frontend, backend, and database to implement new features
Conduct code reviews, design UIs (Ant Design), and create database models (Prisma)
Reworked authentication process for Angular web app to use OAuth 2.0
Optimized user experience in a 1 million+ user web app by implementing design enhancements
Utilized git and GitHub for collaboration and safety of production software
Monitored and resolved issues for ~4,000 BYU websites, network devices, servers, and processes
Identified and addressed potential issues with a message response time under 1 minute
Mentored 78 high schoolers in starting a company with over $250 in profit in 4 weeks
Increased student understanding by leading discussions on business concepts for 2 hours/week
Learned 3D printing by helping teams prototype the products for their business

experience.position: TA for Intro to Data Science
responsibilities: Managed grading for ~110 students' weekly Python assignments
Built strong teaching skills by conducting one-on-one tutoring sessions
Assisted professor by reworking 6 different assignments for clarity and readability
Prototyped a mobile app for helping K-12 schools find, book, and coordinate field trips
Wrote ~1,600 lines of Swift code for the frontend of the app

projects.name: Spring
projects.description: Chrome Extension to prevent endless scrolling
bullets: Developed a Chrome Extension using React and TypeScript to prevent endless scrolling on websites
The longer you scroll the harder it gets to move down the page, until you can't scroll anymore, just like a spring

projects.name: Mood Memo
projects.description: Mood Tracking and Journaling app in Flutter
bullets: Built a mobile app for mood tracking and journaling and published it to the iOS and Android app stores
Programmed the app using ~2,000 lines of Flutter / Dart code

projects.name: Scalamental
projects.description: 2D GameMaker game for GitHub Game Off 2023
bullets: Competed in GitHub's month-long game making competition by building a 2D action game themed to chameleons
Learned GameMaker, a game engine for 2D games, while working together with 2 other friends

projects.name: YouTube Comment Filter
bullets: Developed an Angular Chrome extension for sorting YouTube comments by sentiment
Designed and implemented the extension with 4 friends over 24 hours
Awarded best design at the hackathon

projects.name: E-waste Facts
bullets: Advocated for e-waste reduction through the creation of a website
Invested ~10 hours building the site using custom HTML/CSS/Bootstrap

projects.name: Be Rated
projects.description: Social Media Rating App in Flutter with BYU Dev Club
bullets: Developed collaborative programming skills by writing a mobile app with the BYU Developers Club
Storyboarded app layout and features to achieve the best design
Developed parts of the frontend in Flutter over 8 months

projects.name: Chess
projects.description: Chess Server and Client in Java
bullets: Wrote over 5,500 lines of Java code for a chess server and client for a class project
Implemented the rules of chess in Java using object-oriented programming
Built a Java server with Spark and used a thread pool to handle multiple clients

projects.name: Personal Website
bullets: Designed and built a personal website to showcase my projects and skills (this website)
Utilized React and custom CSS to create a visually appealing site
